author: jwoolley
msg: apr_bucket_file_create() and apr_bucket_file_make() now take a pool
parameter which is the pool into which any needed data structures
should be created during file_read().  This is used for MMAPing the
file and reopening the file if the original apr_file_t is in XTHREAD
The end result is that file buckets now correctly support XTHREAD files,
even if the platform does not handle them natively.

author: wrowe
msg: Add missing apr_uri header to the win32 projects

author: stoddard
msg: Keep apr_file_dup() from being called with garbage in the fd pointer.
